column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=1 .
#Text=Introduction
#Text=The demand for energy supply is a key issue for the global economy .
#Text=The petroleum supply plays an important role in primary energy .
#Text=In the petroleum supply networks , sand transport is generally a severe problem for most oil and gas reservoirs all over the world .
#Text=It is more important especially for the subsea production systems considering the flow assurance .
#Text=The deposition of solid sand in the pipe bottom and equipment can cause a series of risks .
#Text=For instance , the formation of the sand bed in the pipeline decreases the flow area and correspondingly increases the frictional pressure losses .
#Text=Moreover , sand transport can cause erosion and corrosion problems as a result of the impact on the pipe wall and the microbial attack under the sand bed .
#Text=In addition , the slurry flow containing sands could lead to equipment failure .
#Text=Therefore , the deposition and transport of the sand in slurry flows attract much attention , and it is also a very significant issue in the petroleum industry .

#Text=A series of computer-controlled experiments were conducted in a thin fluid ( like water ) and the key parameter distribution was obtained at various flow rates , injected sand concentrations , and fluid viscosities . Doron et al. experimentally studied the transport behaviour of the coarse solids in a horizontal pipeline .
#Text=Gillies and Shook employed the traversing gamma-ray gauges to measure the sand concentration in a horizontal pipeline with coarse solids nominally from 180 to 2400 μm .

#Text=Their results indicated that the maximal concentration gradient ( 0.47 in their studies ) was irrelevant to the mean velocity . Gillies et al. experimentally studied the sand transport characteristics in a horizontal pipeline with viscous Newtonian fluids .

#Text=Their results showed that a pressure gradient of 2 kPa/m was required to transport sand in laminar flow . Kaushal et al. conducted a series of experiments to study the sand transport characteristic in multiphase flow pipelines .

#Text=The measurement of the pressure drop and concentration was experimentally observed in the liquid-solid slurry flow . Duan et al. investigated experimentally the critical resuspension velocity and the critical deposition velocity for different size sands in slurry flows .

#Text=It indicated that the critical resuspension velocity was two to three times smaller than the critical deposition velocity . Najmi et al. experimentally studied the critical flow rate of gas and liquid to keep particles moving in a horizontal pipeline in stratified and intermittent flow with a small liquid hold-up of about 0.02 .

#Text=The volume fraction of the solid phase ( 0.01 – 0.1 % ) was experimentally measured in a horizontal pipeline at a very low concentration . Rice et al. utilized two kinds of particles including the glass and plastic solids to understand the sand transport behaviour in the multiphase flow pipeline .
#Text=A computational model was developed by Roco and Shook to predict the quasi-uniform slurry flow with the range of sand volume concentration below 40 % .
#Text=Their simulated results of concentration and velocity were compared with experimental data and showed a good agreement .

#Text=The sand transport process was investigated in a horizontal well by means of numerical simulations . Ebadian et al. developed an algebraic slip mixture model to predict the sand transport behaviour within a horizontal pipeline .
#Text=Their comparison of the pressure drop between the computational and experimental results showed a good agreement .
#Text=Danielson considered the slip velocity to develop a two-fluid model for the slurry flows , and a good agreement between the simulation and experiment was obtained in the sand bed height .
#Text=An analytical near-wall model was developed to describe the liquid-solid two-phase flow , and the numerical result showed a good agreement with the experimental concentration .
#Text=A two-fluid model was proposed to predict the fully suspended slurry flow , and it was validated by experimental data .
#Text=In another study , they proposed an improved mathematical model for the slurry flow within a horizontal pipeline .
#Text=The comparison between the simulation and experiment showed that the new model was more accurate than the previous one .
#Text=Hadinoto adapted the two-fluid flow model to predict the turbulence modulation characteristic in a vertical pipeline at a low solid volume fraction from 0.5 % to 4.0 % .
#Text=The numerical and experimental results showed that the drag correlation significantly affected the accuracy of the computational fluid dynamics ( CFD simulation ) .
#Text=The Euler-granular model was employed by Kaushal et al. to predict the sand transport behaviour in a horizontal pipeline with fine particles at high concentrations .

#Text=The concentration distributions of the numerical and experimental results were in good agreement . Soepyan et al. developed a CFD model to predict the fluid velocity of the slurry flow in a horizontal pipeline at a low concentration by volume .
#Text=Table 1 lists recent studies on sand transport and deposition in multiphase flow pipelines with a focus on low concentration conditions .
#Text=These studies demonstrated the importance of the effect of sands on the flow process even in low concentrations for multiphase flow pipelines .
